txt.en: 'Ah, [placeholder]! I had begun to wonder where you'd gone.\n\n'You've arrived just in time. Come, let us speak.'
Glóin can be found in the war-room of Annâk-khurfu.\n\nYou have found Glóin in the old keep of Annâk-khurfu. You should speak to Glóin.
Amidst the bustling war-room, you spy Glóin beside a table in the distance

'Indeed, but that is only a wishful thought.

'You have a duty to Durin and his army to see this march to its end, and I would not have you break an oath on my account. Most of the dwarves I have seen pass through the Slade have mustered at Annâk-khurfu. I overheard one of them speak the name Glóin. Is this name known to you?'

You tell Nagli that Glóin is an old friend and a commander of the army passing through Elderslade.

'It is there you must go then—to Glóin and your allies.

'Beware the dangers that lie beyond our little encampment, [placeholder]. May good fortune be with you!'
Find Glóin in the old keep of Annâk-khurfu
As the Want-kin bid you farewell, the conflict in Elderslade grows greater just beyond Annâk-khurfu.
Annâk-khurfu can be found to the west of Khadâsh-gâra in Elderslade.\n\nYou have arrived at Annâk-khurfu and you should now enter the old ruins in search of Glóin.

Annâk-khurfu can be found to the west of Khadâsh-gâra in Elderslade.\n\nNagli Want-kin has suggested that you rejoin Durin's army at the dwarf-ruins of Annâk-khurfu. You should travel to Annâk-khurfu.
The impressive dwarf-ruins of Annâk-khurfu loom overhead, but you see no sign of Glóin
